website_summaries.verdict: Premium craftsmanship for a reasonable price.
pros: Holds a sharp edge after many uses
cons: Expect to sharpen it before you use this hatchet

customer_reviews.title: Victim of axe hipster reviews, a high price doesn't translate to better quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere near worth $85. The head was misshapen near the top of the blade, and it looks like whoever did the grind noticed it and decided not to grind that area... probably because it would snap the top part of the blade right off. The head was also seated crooked onto the shaft. Poor quality assurance for such "prestigious" tool maker. My plastic Fiskars x7 at the $20 price point feels like a better quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mat K

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This axe was awful. The edge was asymmetric. The axe head itself was asymmetric. It dulled very quickly. The blade chipped in a single week of use. I only took the axe out throwing twice! I threw it in my axe throwing gym. There is no excuse for this quality of work. DO NOT BUY!!! I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent hatchet, was hoping for just a bit more
customer_reviews.text: I uploaded a number of photos, from when I first got the hatchet, so you can really see what my review might leave out. With that said, and as others have commented as well, the finish on the head it self could have been much better. For a mid-to-upper end hatchet, it looks as though the head was quickly process through their production operation. Now with that said, this criticism may be cosmetic only. I will update the review if the function is lacking in any way. I'm not disappointed with the purchase, just wanted a bit more...
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Hult Bruk Tanaby hatchet review
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet arrived in good shape packaged well. It hatchet appears to be well made and has good balance. It is not what I consider sharp, but I should be able to put a super sharp edge on it fairly quickly. I'm happy with the purchase as it is a well made hatchet and should serve me well. It also comes with a sheath and a info book.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is built of quality metal, professional craftsmanship and built to last. It can chop down a good size tree for firewood and fits great in your pack. The sheath is useless and would be better if it had a belt loop, but don't let that stop you from buying it because other are made that work better.
customer_reviews.author: Spruce

customer_reviews.title: Good axe for the money
customer_reviews.text: This axe is beautiful. What most reviewers don't understand is that this is a hand forged axe. There are going to be small blemishes and imperfections this is normal when forming high carbon steal. It's sharp but as always when purchasing an axe there is time and effort that goes into preparing it. On the users side. Nothing a little boiled linseed oil, a cup of deisel fuel, and a sharpening stone won't fix. It is sharp it cuts with ease. Far better than the eastwing I had
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Great Hatchet - Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the size. Came incredibly sharp on arrival and have had phenomenal results so far. I may eventually upgrade to something a bit bigger, but the quality and application for this hatchet are not to be questioned. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Lemieux

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all purpose small axe
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. This is a serious tool. Quality and construction of the head is superior. Very sharp and easy to sharpen. Small splitting jobs or any other chopping chore short of felling a large tree...this great little axe will do it all. Well balanced with an well shaped and functional design. So good I bought a Hults large splitting axe. You will not be disappointed in this professional quality manual tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gitfiddleman

customer_reviews.title: Takes and keeps an edge
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in the hand, the edge keeping ability seems pretty good. I use it for splitting quarters into kindling and for feathering the kindling. I am happy with this purchase. Caveat: this is the only hatchet/axe I have used and have no way to compare with other products. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: sparty

customer_reviews.title: great axe for camping
customer_reviews.text: It's a little giant. It's size has nothing to do with the capacity, great axe for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet, very sharp, came with a decent leather sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Elias M. Vidaurri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Classy and tough. Great price for a great axe. This'll last forever. I bought two as gifts, and my pals love the axe.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Great little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hatchet! It was exactly what i was looking for.For the price, I held it to the highest quality standard and would have given 5 stars if the craftsmanship was just a bit smoother.That said,im not displeased! Feels great in hand and the leather sheath is great! Just in time for my elk hunt..cant wait to put it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: My second Hults Bruk!
customer_reviews.text: Love these axes! To me this is a piece of art! High quality and came very sharp! The best hatchet at this price point hands down. Tried and true! Comfortable handle and the fit and finish is superb! Does what it’s suposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: rockabillybanger

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is now one of my favorites. I have a few axes and hatchets, I’m a little bit of a collector. This one is right there with the best.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nice mid to upper quality tool for the price, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, descent price. Exactly what I expected which is all I could ask for. Handle isn’t too small, head is mounted straight, easy to remove blade sheath, good weight for camping/hiking but not too light. Only improvement would be that it would be nice if it were a little sharper out of the box. Needs sharpening prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hatchet, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a nice hatchet. Exactly as described, very sharp out of the box. I matched it with H&D belt sheat.
customer_reviews.author: Klamath

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for mid priced tool.
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet came a little on the dull side. handle was a nice and the ergonomics are good for swinging. It performed well on 3-5 inch trees. Not very good for shavings, but a nice knife will take care of that. Not too heavy for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this hatchet to everyone
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an affordable quality hatchet, look no further. I've been using this hatchet for bushcamping for about 3 months now, and it is a valuable piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: this is an excellent axe to rough cut prior to carving
customer_reviews.author: mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. These are a bit higher priced than some that are available, but the quality is there so I feel it is worth the money. This will last and last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little carving hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for rough-out carving. Extremely sharp and holds its edge well. Just the right weight and shape for the work. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet. I love the quality at a significantly lower price than a Gransfors Bruks
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: The best handy hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this to my boyfriend for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. He uses it for everything around the farm. It has a great weight to it and is comfortable to hold. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Austin

customer_reviews.title: Uneven grind- Sloppy blacksmithing
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this purchase. Sloppy blacksmithing. Both edges are completely uneven. Even with decent axe a ship technique, this axe does not get the job done like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very Solid! I bought like 5 or 6 for my wedding present gift, and they were a huge hit among brothers
customer_reviews.author: PMB

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Used on fire wood at ~12,000ft, cut cleanly. Came extremely sharp. I also used it to break the pelvis of a mule deer in the field and cut the ribs out with it. Phenomenal axe. Sharpened up quickly after use. Blood washed off the handle in a stream, dried it out at room temp, no cracking in the handle. Needs some linseed oil to be perfect, maybe a collar.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom quality.  Will last for generations
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift and I really did not want to part with it. What a masterpiece of metal, wood and leather.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first hatchet
customer_reviews.text: The wood was clean. looked decently made! I mean I don’t know I’m not a axe-pert. but it looked awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelee Eads

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy swing, but it makes it chew up wood that much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little hatchet! Very good quality and nice sharp blade from the factory. All you need to do is add some linseed oil to the handle and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: knuckles75

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet. Hubby is very happy with the way it cuts pieces of wood for our fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Daniele H

customer_reviews.title: Sharpend right away good quality
customer_reviews.text: I used it to trim bark off trees as I build a log cabin. Con for me is short handle 🤨
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my husband! It is great quality & arrived as stated. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: JAY MURPHY

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet. Built a great shelter my first time out with it. Highly recommend for light campsite duty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So nice your friends will copy you
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and just what you would expect it to be but cheaper than what you will find in department stores. Few of my friends have seen it and all have asked where did you get it. Will enjoy this axe for many years.
customer_reviews.author: the collins group

customer_reviews.title: if its like its big brother the almike i'm sure its a ...
customer_reviews.text: if its like its big brother the almike i'm sure its a wonderful item to own..returned mine for the Alimike little more versatile to camp and hike needs in the brush..
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Best hatchet on Amazon.Very sweet,well balanced and with the right weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ogostaboy

product_meta.title: Hults Bruk Tarnaby Hatchet
product_meta.description:
The Hults Bruk Tarnaby is a small, all-purpose hatchet for basic uses such as making kindling, doing light clearing and working in the garden.

This item has an axe head weight of 1.25 Lbs and a handle length of 15 inches. The head is the product of blasted and clear-lacquered ironwork and the curved shaft is made of US-sourced hickory. The handle is treated with linseed oil.
feature_bullets: This axe head is hand-forged and made from Swedish axe steel in a foundry that has been in operation since 1697.
As part of the production process, the steel is struck multiple times thereby increasing its density and resulting in more durability of the axe.
The head is constructed in such a way that there is a tempered zone designed to hold a very sharp edge even after many sharpenings.

Each axe comes with a traditional leather protective sheath that is embellished with some unique Swedish decorative elements. The axe is shipped in its own storage box and comes with a detailed users manual.
